meanings.definition: To secure (a rope) by attaching to a fixed point.
meanings.sent1: She belayed the rope to the sturdy tree.
meanings.sent2: The climber always belayed the rope before ascending.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel belayed the rope to the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: His determination belayed the rope of doubt in his mind.
meanings.sent5: The sailor's hands expertly belayed the rope, ensuring safety.

meanings.sent1: The traffic jam belayed his arrival at the party.
meanings.sent2: She belayed her response until she had all the facts.
meanings.sent3: The sleepy cat belayed the start of the meeting by napping on the agenda.
meanings.sent4: His fear of failure belayed his progress in the project.
meanings.sent5: The storm clouds belayed the picnic, sending everyone indoors.
